intro: Paradrymonia anisophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed paradrymonia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia, particularly in Queensland. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the wet season. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
